title: Ticket #6437: Fix JSON and XML output of condor_history
description:
When condor_history reads from multiple history files, it prints extra header/footer text for the JSON and XML formats for each file. The resulting output is invalid JSON/XML.

Here's some sample JSON output with ads read from two history files: 

% condor_history -limit 4 -attributes clusterid,procid -json -limit 4
[
{
  "procid": 0,
  "clusterid": 968
}
,
{
  "procid": 0,
  "clusterid": 967
}
,
{
  "procid": 0,
  "clusterid": 966
}
]
[
,
{
  "procid": 0,
  "clusterid": 965
}
]

Also, the -attributes argument is ignored when -forwards is used.
remarks:
2017-Oct-18 10:14:12 by johnkn:
CODE_REVIEW change looks good. I noticed a minor inconsistency. use_json is ignored when printing if longformat is false, but it is NOT ignored when printing the json header and footer when longformat is false. I believe this is moot since the -json argument sets both longformat and use_json.

2017-Oct-25 10:25:56 by tim:
Doc Review: OK

2017-Oct-10 10:23   Check-in [52532]: Make -attributes and -forwards work together in condor_history. #6437 When reading a history file in forwards mode, apply the projection when printing each ad, the same as when in backwards mode. (By Jaime Frey )
